# Chord Entity: Major 7b5 in A (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Major 7b5 chord (also known as Major 7 flat 5 or half-diminished chord) combines a major quality with a diminished fifth interval. In the key of A, forming a C Major 7b5 chord involves the notes C, E, G#, and B. This distinctive and sophisticated chord creates a rich, jazzy sound often found in complex jazz compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (C)
- Major third (E)
- Augmented fifth (G#)
- Major seventh (B)

This chord combines the qualities of a major 7th chord and a diminished chord. The key element that sets it apart is the diminished fifth (G#), which gives it its unique and slightly dissonant character.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7b5 chord is frequently used in jazz music, particularly in more advanced harmonic settings where musicians are looking to introduce complex, colorful sounds into their compositions. It adds a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to music, creating tension and intrigue that can resolve in interesting ways.
